bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition According to the Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 this term is to be divided into mao gui 貓鬼 and ye dao 野道 . Mao gui 貓鬼 refers to harm inflicted on humans by the spirits ofcats they raise. Ye dao 野道 refers to diseases caused by gu 蠱 spirits roaming without a host on roads in the wilderness. Ever since the Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 , the two terms have been used in combination to refer to mental states characterized by photism, phonism, singing and wailing. Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 25 lists a 治貓鬼野道病歌哭不自由 方 , “Recipe to cure the disease cat-demon-on-a-road-in-the-wilderness with involuntary singing and wailing”.
